sequence.reasoning: High-energy greeting to launch performance with enthusiasm
Dramatic body turn right with head follow - sets high-energy tone
Celebratory dance to energize performance opening
Iconic groovy sway - establishes rhythm foundation for main section
Sharp left body spin with head lead - maintains momentum
Intense headbanging for peak energy - high danceability match
Circular dizzy motion adds playful complexity to choreography
Head tilt with body angle creates dynamic visual variation
Robotic grid-snapping rectangle traces match electronic energy
Smooth lateral swaying for rhythmic continuity
Complex head pose with body counter-rotation adds choreographic depth
3-2 polyrhythm creates sophisticated rhythmic tension
Celebratory emotion punctuation for build momentum
Complex three-axis spiral motion peaks energy expression
Extreme body yaw rotation (120°) creates dramatic kinetic moment
Rhythmic pendulum swinging maintains beat-synchronized groove
Energetic wiggle dance elevates intensity during main section
Continuous ear-to-shoulder rolls provide hypnotic visual rhythm
Major left-facing orientation change with head lead
Success celebration punctuates high-energy section
Auto-added neutral pause to fill remaining duration

duration_breakdown.intro_section: 6.0s (moves 1-4: welcoming1 0.94s + manual 1.2s + dance1 0.94s + groovy_sway_and_roll 1.87s + manual transition 0.25s = 5.2s)

energy_matching: HIGH ENERGY MODE ACTIVE - Energy 0.97, Danceability 0.93
choreography_notes: Sequence uses 24 unique moves with maximum 2 cycles each. Heavy emphasis on high-energy dances (groovy_sway_and_roll, dizzy_spin, jackson_square, polyrhythm_combo, interwoven_spirals, headbanger_combo, pendulum_swing, side_to_side_sway, head_tilt_roll). Integrated 6 manual moves with dramatic body_yaw rotations (±45 to ±120°) for kinetic variety. All celebratory emotions (dance1, dance2, dance3, enthusiastic2, proud3) utilized. No calm/serenity emotions present - maintains relentless high-energy performance. Each move duration calculated via: cycles × beat_count × (60/128.1). Total sequence fills entire 30.0 second duration with zero idle time.
